courses.title: The Business Consultant Learning Event
courses.bio: VETERANSWERS Member
requirements: The desire to learn about to business consultancy
courses.description:
Financial Management: This area involves managing an organization's financial resources to ensure financial stability and growth. It includes budgeting, financial planning, financial analysis, cash flow management, and risk assessment. Financial managers make decisions about investments, funding sources, and capital allocation to maximize profitability and sustainability.
Human Resource Management: Managing people within an organization is vital for its success. This area involves activities such as recruitment, training, performance appraisal, employee relations, compensation and benefits administration, and workforce planning. Effective human resource management helps create a productive and motivated workforce.
Marketing and Sales Management: Marketing and sales are essential for attracting and retaining customers and driving revenue. Marketing managers focus on market research, product development, pricing, promotion, and distribution strategies. Sales managers oversee the sales team, set sales targets, and develop sales strategies to meet revenue goals.
Operations Management: Operations managers are responsible for ensuring the efficient production and delivery of products or services. This area includes supply chain management, production planning, quality control, inventory management, and process improvement. Effective operations management enhances productivity and reduces costs.
Strategic Management: This area involves setting the overall direction and long-term goals of the organization. Strategic managers assess the competitive landscape, identify opportunities and threats, and develop strategies to gain a competitive advantage. They make decisions about entering new markets, diversifying product lines, and positioning the company for future success.
Information Technology (IT) Management: IT management focuses on leveraging technology to support business operations and objectives. It includes managing IT infrastructure, systems development, data security, and digital transformation initiatives. IT managers ensure that technology investments align with the organization's goals and enhance efficiency and innovation.
These six areas are fundamental to business management, but it's important to note that they often overlap and interconnect. Effective business management requires coordination among these areas to achieve the organization's overall goals and objectives. Additionally, as businesses evolve and adapt to changing circumstances, new management areas and priorities may emerge, such as sustainability management or data analytics management, which can further enhance the organization's competitiveness and sustainability.

courses.description:
Have you always wanted to write a book but never actually started? You’re not alone. Many aspiring writers dream about creating stories but never put pen to paper. What's holding them back?
The Four Biggest Roadblocks to Writing
Procrastination – Fear of imperfection and lack of motivation keep people from writing.
Time Constraints – Busy schedules leave little room for creative pursuits.
Perfectionism – The need for a “perfect” draft prevents many from starting.
Self-Doubt – Fear of criticism discourages potential writers from sharing their ideas.
Starting is the hardest part—but it’s also the most crucial step. The blank page can be intimidating, and the vulnerability of self-expression can feel overwhelming. But once you begin, the magic unfolds.
Why You Should Write
Self-Reflection: Writing helps you understand your thoughts and emotions.
Communication: It improves your ability to express ideas effectively.
Creativity & Innovation: Writing unlocks new ways of thinking and problem-solving.
The Power of Children's Books
Children’s books have the potential to shape young minds and impact future generations by:
Developing literacy
Teaching values
Encouraging imagination
Promoting cultural awareness
Creating lifelong memories
The Key to Writing a Great Book
Find a unique theme that sets your book apart.
Keep it personal for authenticity, passion, and connection.
Research your niche and competitors for accuracy and engagement.
Use imagination to make your story creative, original, and captivating.
Understanding Your Audience
Each age group has different reading needs. Whether you're writing for babies, toddlers, or young adults, knowing your audience is essential.
The Writing Process & Publishing Essentials
Structuring your book: Learn how to outline your ideas and build a compelling story.
Taking notes: Discover how to organize and reference ideas effectively.
Finding an illustrator: Learn how to bring your vision to life with the right artist.
Copyrighting & ISBNs: Protect your work and understand book distribution options.
This course will guide you from idea to published book, helping you turn your writing dreams into reality. Enroll today and start your journey as an author!

courses.title: Foundations of Organizational Behavior
courses.bio: Discover the science behind workplace dynamics and learn to navigate and influence organizational behavior effectively!
objectives: The foundational concepts of organizational behavior and its contributing disciplines.
Key models and theories, including attitudes, personality, and values.
The psychology behind perception, decision-making, and attribution.
Practical applications of behavior modification and reinforcement.

Knowledge about Attribute Theory: Errors and bias in decision making

requirements: A basic understanding of workplace environments is helpful but not mandatory. A willingness to learn and apply psychological and sociological concepts to real-world scenarios.
courses.description:
Introduction:
Organizational behavior is the cornerstone of effective management and workplace success. This course, Foundations of Organizational Behavior: Insights, Models, and Applications, offers an in-depth exploration of how individuals and groups act within organizations. By understanding behavior models, personality dynamics, and decision-making processes, participants will gain the tools to foster collaboration, enhance productivity, and drive organizational success.
Section 1: Overview of Organizational Behavior
This section lays the groundwork for understanding organizations, starting with their structures, functions, and dynamics. Students will be introduced to the principles that define organizational behavior, setting the stage for deeper exploration into the field.
Section 2: Intuition, Skills, Definitions, and the Hawthorne Studies
In this section, participants learn the theoretical and practical aspects of intuition, essential skills for workplace success, and the definition of organizational behavior. The pivotal Hawthorne studies are also explored, showcasing their historical importance and relevance in understanding employee motivation and productivity.
Section 3: Organizational Behavior Models
The focus here is on understanding the OB model and its contributing disciplines, such as psychology, sociology, and anthropology. Students will also examine how values influence organizational culture and employee behavior.
Section 4: Attitude and Personality in the Workplace
Attitudes and personality play a significant role in workplace interactions. This section delves into theories of attitude, job satisfaction, and personality frameworks, emphasizing how these factors contribute to job fit and overall organizational harmony.
Section 5: Theories of Perception, Attribution, and Decision-Making
Students explore perception, including attribution theory and the shortcuts often used in judging others. Decision-making processes, common errors, and biases are also examined, offering practical strategies to improve judgment and choices in the workplace.
Section 6: Behavior, Learning, and Reinforcement in Organizations
This section focuses on learning theories, behavior modification, and the role of reinforcement in shaping behavior. Students will understand the application of these concepts in fostering a productive and positive workplace culture.
Conclusion:
Foundations of Organizational Behavior: Insights, Models, and Applications equips participants with the knowledge and tools needed to understand and improve workplace dynamics. By mastering organizational behavior, students will be better prepared to influence positive outcomes, build effective teams, and thrive in leadership roles.
target_audience: Aspiring and current managers seeking to improve team management and organizational effectiveness.
Students and professionals interested in organizational psychology and behavior.
HR professionals aiming to foster a positive workplace culture.
Anyone looking to enhance their understanding of workplace dynamics and personal interactions.

courses.description:
Gestão de riscos é a coordenação de todas as atividades relacionadas a evitar que uma organização seja afetada de forna negativas (ou deixe de aproveitar de forma positiva) uma conjuntura ou cenário futuro, ou mesmo um incidente interno ou externo com potencial de acontecimento recorrente.
Todas as empresas grandes ou pequenas correm algum risco de não atingir seus objetivos, mostraremos através desta norma como deve ser a gestão de riscos dentro da organização. Ao final, você estará pronto para implementar ferramentas e métodos capazes de tornar o processo mais eficaz.
Para ter um bom gerenciamento e controle de riscos, é fundamental que os riscos sejam quantificados e qualificados. Dessa forma, é possível eliminar ou reduzir as possíveis perdas financeiras, bem como maximizar o aproveitamento das oportunidades positivas de ganhos e geração de valor para as pessoas e organizações.
O curso vai interpretar todos os requisitos da Norma NBR ISO 31000 na sua nova versão 2018.
O curso mostra como usar a Planilha de WHAT IF (E SE), mostra também como usar a planilha FMEA e ainda como usar o APPCC para empresas que possui sistema de Gestão da Segurança de Alimentos.

Exercise 2: Find the Circular Economy processes that avoid waste

requirements: No prerequisites.
courses.description:
Our current economic model is coming to an end.


Yes, this is no joke.


Over the last few decades, we have extracted, transformed and exploited our natural resources as if we were living in a world without limits.
We see the consequences of this every day: the climate crisis, the decline in biodiversity, income inequality and the concentration of wealth, to name but a few.
These consequences have an impact not only on the world's population but also on all organisations (businesses, associations, etc.).


Yes, you risk being affected..


You are taking the risk that your company will not be able to withstand future shocks. Environmental events are becoming more and more frequent, and governments are becoming stricter and stricter, with increasingly stringent regulations.


So what can you do about it?


The circular economy appears to be a promising solution to the problems of our century, which are as interdependent as they are existential.


But if you're here, that means you're already aware of it.


However, you're looking to deepen your knowledge of the subject and want to find out how to apply the circular economy in your organisation.


Good news, we can help!


The Circulab Academy offers a two-hour training course to help you take your first steps in the circular economy.
You will understand the impacts and effects of current linear economic models. You will identify the benefits and challenges of a circular and regenerative economy.
You will be inspired and realise how to activate the potential for economic and social transformation of the circular economy.


Read Tali W's testimonial: "Excellent training that helps you quickly get a first idea of what the circular economy is and how to implement it in the business world!"
target_audience: This course is for anyone who wants to take their first steps in the circular economy.

courses.description:

courses.title: Understanding Markets: Perfect Competition
courses.bio: A guide to understand Perfect Competition
objectives: Define market in terms of its features
Learn about market structure and its different forms
Understand basic concepts of revenue and costs
Explain basic postulates of perfect competition
Explain equilibrium of a perfectly competitive (PC) firm both in the short-run and long-run
Interpret the Production decision of PC firm in the short-run
Illustrate when a firm produces facing loss

Perfect Competition: Its Basic Postulate: Why is a PC firm said to be price taker?
Why do AR and MR curve become the price line in PC?
Short-run equilibrium of PC Firm: TR-TC Method
Short-run equilibrium of PC Firm: MR-MC Method
Short-run Equilibrium & Production Decis: Does equilibrium guarantee excess profit to firm in the short run
Super Normal Profit in the Short-run
Normal Profit or Break Even Production Decision
When does a firm face loss in the short run under PC?
Production Decision Facing Loss: Production Decision Facing Loss- by Table
When should firm produce when there is loss at equilibrium?
When should the Firm stop its production

requirements: No specific prerequisites are necessary
All concepts are introduced slowly and gradually, but comfort with thinking analytically will be helpful
courses.description:
The course contains four sections.
Section A defines market introducing its essential features. It also defines market structure and its different forms. The basic concepts of revenue and costs that are necessary to understand the operation of firms in different market structures are discussed in detail.
Section B works with basic postulates of Perfect Competition (PC) . The price taking role of firm under PC that makes it unique from firms in other market structure is discussed in detail. The concepts of total revenue (TR), average revenue (AR) and marginal revenue (MR) under PC is explained.
Section C focuses on the short-run equilibrium of PC firm. In this section, learners will also be able to know the production decision of a PC firm in the short-run. Firm's super normal profit situation, normal profit or break even situation, and the situation of loss will be examined with necessary illustrations.
Whether firm produces in the short-run facing loss or not is an important issue. Section D provides a detail when a firm under PC produces in the short-run and when it stops operation facing loss. It ends with the examination of lung run equilibrium of PC firm.
The course consists of 20 lectures and a total of 1 hour 40 minutes.  It combines both mathematical and graphical contents where possible, so that one can learn alternative ways of interpreting the concepts.

The course is designed considering the desire of students of economics and business. But the contents are arranged in such a way that learners from other disciplines can easily go through the course.
target_audience: The course is designed considering the desire of the students of economics and business
It will be easy going for the learners of other disciplines having analytical thinking attitude

courses.title: Concepts of the Information Industry

objectives: Understanding Information Production: Grasp the definition and importance of creating and generating data, as well as practical examples.
Building Infrastructure: Learn how to establish efficient systems for information processing, ensuring data security and accessibility.
Quality Assurance Techniques: Discover methods for ensuring the accuracy and reliability of information to prevent misinformation.
Utilizing Automation: Understand how automation technologies enhance productivity in information processes.

Module 7: Global Information Executive Office & Office Systems

requirements: Basic Computer Skills: Familiarity with computers and internet browsing is necessary.
Interest in Information Management: A willingness to learn about the role of technology in information processing and automation.
courses.description:
In today's data-driven landscape, the efficient management and processing of information have become critical to successful decision-making, research, and communication. This course, "Effective Information Management and Automation Strategies," is designed for professionals and students alike who wish to deepen their understanding of information processes and leverage automation to enhance productivity.
The course begins by exploring the foundational aspects of information production. Students will learn what constitutes information, the processes involved in its generation, and its significance in various contexts. By examining real-world examples, participants will appreciate how article writing, surveys, and data collection contribute to the wider knowledge pool.
As we transition into the building of information processing infrastructure, students will discover best practices in establishing efficient systems and technologies. Ensuring data security, accessibility, and scalability is paramount, so we will examine how to implement databases and cloud storage solutions to manage vast amounts of information effectively.
Next, the course will address the critical aspect of publishing information. Students will learn the various channels available for distributing knowledge and ideas to a broader audience. Together, we will analyze different publishing formats, from traditional print to modern digital releases, understanding their respective benefits and challenges.
A key focus of the course will be on assuring quality in information. In an age where misinformation can easily spread, fostering a culture of trust and credibility in data is crucial. Participants will explore techniques like fact-checking and peer-review processes, equipping them with the tools needed to maintain high standards of quality and accuracy.
As we dive into the transaction industries of information, learners will investigate the economic implications of buying, selling, and exchanging information products or services. We will discuss how online marketplaces, subscription services, and data brokers drive innovation within the digital economy, paving the way for the development of new information products.
Efficiency is essential in information management, necessitating robust process systems. The curriculum includes exploring systems and workflows designed to streamline information processes. Participants will gain hands-on experience with tools like workflow automation software and content management systems, enabling them to enhance productivity and decision-making.
For many professionals, the executive office is where crucial information management occurs. This course will address tools and technologies that facilitate collaboration among team members while supporting strategic decision-making. Students will learn to utilize executive dashboards, video conferencing systems, and project management tools to optimize information flow and communication.
In addition, we will cover support systems integral to maintaining information technologies. Effective IT support services, helpdesk functions, and software updates ensure the smooth operation of information systems. Through case studies and examples, students will grasp how these support roles contribute to an organization's overall efficiency.
Finally, the capstone of our course will explore the power of automation in information processes. We will examine how implementing technologies such as robotic process automation, chatbots, and automated data entry systems not only reduces human error but also saves valuable time and resources. Participants will be encouraged to envision how they can incorporate automation into their own workflows for greater efficiency.
By the end of this course, participants will possess a well-rounded understanding of information management principles and the strategies to implement automation effectively in their professional settings.
target_audience: Professionals in Information Management: Individuals involved in roles such as data analysis, content management, or IT support.
Students and Researchers: Those seeking to enhance their skills in information processing and automation technologies.

courses.title: Introduction to Industrial-Organizational Psychology
courses.bio: Introduction to I/O Psychology
requirements: No prior experience needed; you will learn everything you need to know
courses.description:
In this course, you’ll learn what I-O psychology is, what I-O psychologists do and where work, and some of the field’s major areas of research and practice.
Industrial-Organization (I-0) psychology is one of the fastest-growing fields in science. It’s also one of the least well-understood. Industrial organizational psychology is the branch of psychology that applies psychological theories and principles to organizations. Often referred to as Industrial-Organization (I-0) psychology, this field focuses on increasing workplace productivity and related issues such as the physical and mental wellbeing of employees. Industrial organizational psychologists perform a wide variety of tasks, including studying worker attitudes and behavior, evaluating companies, and conducting leadership training. The overall goal of this field is to study and understand human behavior in the workplace.
The two major sides of Industrial-Organizational Psychology are:
The Industrial side, which involves looking at how to best match individuals to specific job roles. This segment of I-O psychology is also sometimes referred to as personnel psychology.
The organizational side of psychology is more focused on understanding how organizations affect individual behavior. Organizational structures, social norms, management styles, and role expectations are all factors that can influence how people behave within an organization.
Major Topics in Industrial Organizational Psychology:
Training and development
Employee Selection
Ergonomics
Performance Management
Work Life
Organizational Development
target_audience: Human Resources
College undergraduate students in an introductory psychology course
Science journalists who need to know about I-O psychology and I-O psychologists
Anyone who is curious about I-O psychology
Anyone considering I-O psychology as a career

courses.description:
The 2024 Global Internal Audit Standards (formerly known as the IPPF) mark a major evolution in how internal audit functions are expected to operate. Whether you're a Chief Audit Executive, an internal auditor, or a governance professional, understanding these updates is no longer optional — it’s essential.
This crash course is designed to give you a clear, concise, and practical overview of what’s changed in the new standards and how to take action. In under an hour, you’ll learn about the five new domains, the core shifts in structure and philosophy, and the key areas that internal audit teams must adapt to — including ethics, governance, and the delivery of assurance and advisory services.
The course includes templates, checklists, and implementation tools you can start using immediately — making this not just a learning experience, but a working toolkit. Whether you’re updating your audit manual, conducting a gap analysis, or preparing for stakeholder discussions, this course gives you the solid foundation you need.
Perfect for busy professionals who want to stay current and credible, this crash course delivers impactful knowledge without the fluff — and serves as the gateway to a deeper dive in the upcoming Advanced IPPF 2024 Series for audit professionals worldwide.

courses.description:
Artificial Intelligence is no longer a futuristic concept—it’s a powerful reality shaping every business sector today. With the EU AI Act officially enforced and continuously updated (as of August 2025), organizations and professionals must ensure not only ethical use of AI but also regulatory compliance. This course, AI Literacy and EU AI Act Compliance, is designed to bridge the critical gap between AI knowledge and legal obligations.
You’ll start by understanding the EU AI Act’s risk-based framework, including prohibited, high-risk, limited-risk, and minimal-risk AI categories. From there, the course explores the Article 4 literacy requirements, ensuring learners gain the knowledge needed to comply with mandatory AI literacy standards. You’ll also build a foundation in core AI concepts such as machine learning fundamentals, algorithmic bias, explainability, transparency, and ethical considerations.
Through structured modules, the course covers:
AI Risk Assessment & Mitigation: Learn how to evaluate, categorize, and reduce AI risks.
AI Governance & Oversight: Understand organizational responsibilities, record-keeping, and incident reporting.
Privacy & Data Protection: Explore GDPR-aligned practices for safe AI development and deployment.
Practical Business & Management Guidance: Gain actionable strategies for managers, leaders, and teams to implement responsible AI practices.
By the end of this course, you will:
Understand and apply the EU AI Act compliance framework.
Build the AI literacy skills mandated for providers, deployers, and managers.
Recognize and mitigate ethical, privacy, and bias challenges in AI systems.
Develop governance, documentation, and incident response processes for AI oversight.
Equip your organization and career with the knowledge to navigate the future of AI regulation.
This course is constantly updated to reflect the latest regulatory changes, ensuring that your learning stays current, practical, and compliance-focused.
If you’re a business professional, compliance officer, AI practitioner, or leader looking to stay compliant and competitive in the age of AI regulation, this course is your roadmap.
target_audience: Business professionals and managers responsible for adopting AI responsibly.
Compliance officers, risk managers, and legal teams seeking to meet EU AI Act obligations.

courses.description:
This course is for any charitable or community organisation considering working with businesses to run corporate volunteering days. These days are often the worst part of a volunteer management role: random business people who know nothing about your mission, showing up unprepared to do work they don't want to do and didn't know they were coming to do. But it doesn't have to be that way!
In this course I will teach you how to prepare corporate volunteering projects that are beneficial for your organisation and mission and are inspiring and impactful. Using research and case studies I will explain where we've all struggled in the past and how we can resolve those challenges to build projects that are efficient, effective and perhaps even enjoyable.
We will cover common mistakes and challenges and how to solve or avoid them, the differences between businesses and charitable organisations that cause problems, why you should bother working with businesses, how to design successful corporate volunteering projects and what to prepare to make sure you and your organisation are ready to deliver them. We'll also cover common questions such as: should you charge for corporate volunteering days? And is it really worth it?
I hope you find it useful.

courses.title: Emergency Response Plan: Combat Fire, Medical & Work Crises
courses.bio: Respond With Confidence, Protect Your Team And Minimise Disruption In Workplace Emergencies
objectives: Understand crisis management essentials.
Conduct fire safety and evacuation training.
Practise first aid at work.
Implement natural disaster preparedness for UK workplaces.
Highlight effective communication during workplace emergencies.

Emergency Response: Fire, Medical & Cris: First Aid At Work: Managing Medical Emergencies
Natural Disaster Preparedness For UK Workplaces
Post-Emergency Recovery: Returning To Business As Usual

requirements: No specific requirements.
courses.description:
Do you want to implement a safety framework to meet (or exceed) general standards, and to ensure the safety of your employees? Would it be helpful for you to implement policies and procedures to expedite recovery and downtime caused by work emergencies? Are you interested in learning the core principles of responding to emergencies to save precious lives at the workplace? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this course is for you!
Work emergencies can sometimes be inevitable, which is why leaders, managers and stakeholders must work together to build strong procedures and policies to help minimise damage and downtime associated with natural or manmade disasters within the workplace. These emergencies can vary in severity, but under the right conditions, such as during fires, earthquakes or explosions caused by human error, these emergencies have the potential to not only shut down businesses for the short-term but also to take precious lives and cause significant and lingering mental trauma for survivors.
According to a 2024 study conducted as per the UK-based statutory instrument Reporting of Injuries, Diseases and Dangerous Occurrences Regulations, work-related incidents occurring during 2023 and 2024 resulted in the death of around 138 workers in the UK. This statistic highlights the devastating potential of work emergencies and their profound impact on human life. This course is specifically designed to teach business leaders about the importance of building frameworks for work emergencies and the benefits of having policies, training and procedures to help minimise the impact of these emergencies in the workplace.
Over a series of short, engaging video lectures, this course equips you with the essential tools to handle workplace emergencies confidently and competently. You will begin by exploring the fundamentals of crisis management, including the different types of emergencies that can affect UK workplaces and how to develop response protocols that are both preventative and adaptive. Next, you will dive into fire safety and evacuation training, learning how to identify fire hazards, implement fire prevention strategies and create legally compliant evacuation plans. You will be guided through the process of performing and documenting regular fire drills, training fire wardens and maintaining safety equipment in alignment with UK fire safety legislation. You will also practise how to lead calm and effective evacuations in high-pressure situations, whether in an office, warehouse or remote site. Building on your crisis preparedness, the course provides hands-on training in first aid at work. You will learn how to administer initial treatment for a wide range of injuries and medical conditions, including cuts, burns, cardiac arrest and allergic reactions. With guidance aligned to Health and Safety Executive requirements, you will understand how to assess a casualty, manage incidents until emergency services arrive and ensure that your workplace is always ready to meet first aid obligations.
You will then learn how to prepare for natural disasters, which, although less frequent in the UK, are becoming increasingly relevant due to climate change. From flood readiness to severe weather protocols, you will examine how to identify physical vulnerabilities, safeguard employees and ensure continuity of operations. You will explore how to adapt preparedness plans to your specific site and sector, ensuring a tailored approach that reflects both local risks and national guidelines. Finally, you will master the principles of effective communication during emergencies. This includes how to craft clear and timely messages that avoid panic while promoting action and how to coordinate across teams using both digital and in-person channels. You will also discover strategies to maintain two-way communication that fosters trust, as well as how to update stakeholders and authorities during rapidly changing events.
By the end of this course, you will be able to manage multiple types of crises with composure, communicate with clarity and ensure your workplace remains compliant, prepared and resilient. Enrol now to empower yourself and your team with the skills and confidence to respond to emergencies with professionalism and care.
target_audience: Business leaders aiming to streamline recovery and quickly restore operations.
Health & Safety managers focused on ensuring employee safety and addressing threats.
Business continuity managers dedicated to executing recovery plans and mitigating risks.
HR managers working to support employee reintegration, morale and communication.
IT & Infrastructure managers responsible for restoring systems and ensuring data protection.
Facilities & Operations managers overseeing physical recovery with minimal disruption.

courses.title: ﻿When Change Comes to Nonprofits (Ready or Not)
courses.bio: Managing through mergers and crises, and re-envisioning the future
objectives: Real world examples of nonprofits working through crises and transitions
Tools for program evaluation
Tools for organizational evaluation
Options for rebuilding out of a crisis
Elements of successful mergers
Elements of mergers that shouldn’t happen
Degrees of partnership and mergers
Planning tools

Lesson Two - Case Studies in Failure and: Case Studies in Failure and Rebirth

requirements: No prerequisites
Course designed for 501(c)(3) nonprofit charitable organizations in the United States
courses.description:
Change is inevitable, and the challenges thrown at nonprofit organizations can lead to a seeming never ending battle to manage through crises that end up distracting from our missions. In recent years we’ve dealt with recessions, a pandemic, the “great resignation,” and more.
In this course, nonprofit expert, Ken Goldstein, shares several case studies from his experiences of managing through crises as a consultant and interim executive director. You will learn about successful mergers, and merger negotiations that were ended without an agreement. You will learn about organizations that seemed all but doomed, and how they rebuilt to be stronger than ever. And you will hear about an organization that went into bankruptcy, and what factors led to that fateful decision.
Ken will also share several of the tools that he’s used in these situations, and with other consulting clients, for program evaluation and organizational assessment. These tools will help you determine if there are programs you need to cut or transform, and what strengths you can build on. You will also learn about mergers, and other types of cooperation and partnerships, the factors to look for in a good partner, and cautions to be wary of during negotiations.
Whether you are the leader of an organization facing a crisis, or considering a merger, or whether your organization is thriving and you just want to build your toolbox with additional knowledge, this fast-paced course will give you insight and ideas that you can use in assuring your nonprofit’s success.
target_audience: Board members or trustees of 501(c)(3) nonprofit charitable organizations
Nonprofit executive directors and senior staff
Nonprofit leaders considering a merger
Nonprofits managing through a crisis

courses.description:
Description:
Are you looking to improve your debt recovery rates while maintaining strong and respectful relationships with clients?
This comprehensive course will equip you with powerful negotiation skills specifically tailored for effective debt collection in today’s business environment.
Whether you are a credit officer, collections professional, entrepreneur, or small business owner, you will learn how to approach negotiations strategically, ethically, and confidently to achieve win–win outcomes.
Through real-world case studies, interactive role-plays, and proven frameworks, this course covers:
Foundations of Debt Collection Negotiation – Understand why negotiation is critical to debt recovery success and the principles of ethical engagement.
Debtor Psychology – Learn what motivates debtor behavior and how to use that insight during discussions.
Preparation & Strategy – Research debtors, set clear objectives, understand legal and regulatory constraints, and develop actionable negotiation plans.
Effective Communication – Master active listening, empathy, persuasive techniques, and handling difficult conversations with professionalism.
Advanced Negotiation Techniques – From settlement offers and incentives to leveraging data, technology, and third-party collaboration.
Ethical & Legal Considerations – Ensure compliance, manage ESG risks, and handle disputes effectively.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:
1. Negotiate repayment plans that work for both parties
2. Reduce payment defaults and disputes
3. Avoid costly legal battles
4. Build and preserve long-term business relationships
Why Take This Course?
Debt collection is more than just asking for payment—it’s about influence, strategy, and relationship management. This course will transform the way you approach negotiations, giving you practical tools you can apply immediately in your role.
Who Should Enroll:
Credit controllers & collection officers
Loan recovery agents
Entrepreneurs & small business owners
Financial service professionals
Anyone looking to improve their negotiation skills in a debt recovery context

courses.title: Introduction to Contract Surety Bonds
courses.bio: Master the essentials of contract surety underwriting, financial statements, surety history, and more.
objectives: Understand surety basics: what surety is, the history of surety, the parties involved and more
Understand the basics of financial statements and their role in commercial surety
Understand the different types of surety available, with a focus on types of contract surety
Understand surety is important to understand for those in the insurance industry
requirements: Some basic experience of insurance is helpful
courses.description:
This comprehensive course offers a deep dive into the world of contract surety, designed to equip insurance agents, risk management professionals, and anyone involved in the construction field with the foundational knowledge and skills necessary to navigate this specialized field effectively. Over the duration of the course, participants will explore the critical aspects of surety bonds, including their purposes, the parties involved, and the specific roles these bonds play in various industries.
Participants will begin by understanding the fundamental differences between surety bonds and traditional insurance, shedding light on surety's unique nature as a credit relationship rather than a risk transfer mechanism. The course will cover key legislation that impacts the surety industry, such as the Miller Act, which mandates surety bonds for federal construction projects, ensuring a robust legal comprehension that is crucial for practice in the field.
The course structure includes detailed examinations of the various types of surety bonds—ranging from bid bonds to performance and payment bonds. Each type is discussed in context, with scenarios that illustrate their applications and the consequences of bond claims. Moreover, learners will engage with the process of underwriting, learning what makes a viable surety bond candidate and the financial assessments crucial to the process.
Interactive elements such as case studies, real-world scenarios, and quizzes are integrated throughout the course to reinforce learning and application of knowledge. Upon completion, participants will not only gain a certificate but will possess the practical skills and understanding necessary to effectively manage and advise on surety bonds in their professional roles. This course is an essential stepping stone for anyone looking to specialize in this area of risk management and insurance.
target_audience: Insurance agents, construction contractors, or those interested in insurance or surety

courses.description:
■お知らせ
ChatGPTの出力時は途中から2倍速〜2.5倍速にしております。
GPT-4で収録しておりますが基本的にGPT-3.5(無料版)でも使用可能です。


追記： 一部の内容でGPT-3.5(無料版)だと想定した返答が返ってこないという声もいただいております。
講座の内容が全てではなく様々アレンジ可能ですので、
講座の内容をベースにしつつ、ご自身の仕事内容や状況に応じて、自由にアレンジいただければ幸いです。


■コース説明文


【ChatGPT(チャットジーピーティー】は、
基本無料で使え、使い方次第で優秀なアシスタントとして使えるAIサービスです。


2022年に突然登場した『ChatGPT』は、
またたく間に世界中にひろまり、
公開わずか2ヶ月で、1億人のユーザー数を記録しました。


これまで、AIを使って自然な日本語を生成するのは難しいとされていましたが、
『ChatGPT』は自然な言葉で対話することができ、
革命的、革新的だと多くの方が興味、関心を抱いています。


2023年3月にはさらなる改善版『GPT-4』がリリースされ、
2024年7月には精度改善・コスト削減した『GPT-4o-mini』もリリースされています。
2025年には推論モデルの向上(o3)やDeepResearch機能も登場しました。


今後近いうちにビジネスには欠かせない、


- ワード
- エクセル
- パワーポイント
- アウトルック


などにも『GPT』が搭載されることで、
『GPT』を使いこなせるかどうかが、ビジネスにも大きな影響を及ぼすことになります。


そんな時流を受けてこの講座では、
『ChatGPT』をビジネスで活用できるようになる方法を解説しています。


新しい分野でどんどん発展しており、まだまだ僕も勉強中ですので、


「こんなプロンプトをつくるにはどうしたらいい？」
などの相談にも、講座内のQ&Aを通じて対応させていただき、
共有したほうがいいなと思うものは講座内に反映させていきたいと思っています。


■ 更新情報
・2025年5月
5月上旬までに追加された機能の一覧を年表形式で紹介

従来モデル・推論モデル・DeepResearchの違い

courses.bio: Veja os passos para melhorar a gestão de processos através das técnicas de mapeamento e modelagem.
objectives: Mapeamento de processos

requirements: Não.
courses.description:
Todas as empresas possuem processos, mesmo que estes estejam organizados ou não. Sendo assim, torna-se necessária uma boa gestão dos processos organizacionais.
O curso tem o objetivo de preparar você para ser esse agente de gestão de processos, aprenda o que são processos, como eles aparecem na empresa, como podem ser classificados e principalmente, como MAPEAR e MODELAR.
Nas minhas vivências de mentorias e consultorias, percebi que muitas pessoas precisavam de um curso focado e com linguagem simples, então, desenvolvi esse passo a passo com dezenas de aulas sequenciadas para o aprendizado. O curso vai começar falando sobre a gestão dos processos (o que é um processo, por que é necessário mapear os processos, quais são os processos mais críticos para empresa), depois vamos mostrar as diferenças entre processos principais e subprocessos, bem como os diferentes tipos de processos que você encontra na empresa como processos primários, de suporte, gerencial e latente, e como devemos mapear cada um desses. Na sequência, mostro quais são as etapas do mapeamento de processos e quais são as primeiras informações que devemos ter como objetivo e visão da empresa em relação ao mapeamento, estrutura atual... depois, vamos definir quais são os processos da empresa que serão mapeados, principalmente aqueles que impactam no produto ou serviço final, vamos apresentar formulários para que o participante do curso tenha uma ideia de como fazer na prática. Uma vez que os processos são determinados, é a vez de priorizar quem será mapeado primeiro e nesse caso, vou apresentar duas técnicas de priorização, a matriz de impacto e severidade e a análise via KPIs. Então, é a vez de planejarmos o mapeamento, você terá a chance de fazer comigo um cronograma e conhecer as ténicas de mapeamento. Tem mais, uma vez planejado, vou te ensinar a executar o mapeamento, o que dizer, o que anotar, o que fazer... pronto, agora que temos os dados do mapeamento, vamos analisar o resultado (AS-IS) e posteriormente fazer as melhorias (TO-BE). Terminamos o curso modelando os processos através do Bizagi
Com esse curso você poderá atuar  como um freelance de mapeamento e modelagem de processos em pequenas e grandes empresas, escolas, comercios etc.
O que você vai aprender:
Gestão de processos
Classificação de processos
Processos, subprocessos e tarefas
Etapas para o mapeamento de processos
Definição dos dados de negócios
Identificação dos processos na empresa
Priorização dos processos a serem mapeados
Planejar o mapeamento e a modelagem dos processos
As técnicas de mapeamento de processos
A execução do mapeamento de processos
A análise do mapeamento (AS-IS)
A melhoria dos processos mapeados (TO-BE)
A modelagem dos processos via software Bizagi.

courses.description:
The Sales and Service Excellence course is designed to equip participants with the essential skills and knowledge to excel in customer-centric environments. This comprehensive online course focuses on various touch points and explores how businesses can effectively deliver on their brand promises.
Participants will delve into the GUEST model, a powerful framework that guides them through each stage of customer interaction to ensure a seamless experience. The course will cover the following key topics:
Touch Points: Understand the significance of touch points in customer interactions and learn how to create memorable experiences at each interaction point.
Types of Brand Promises: Discover different types of brand promises and explore how they shape customers' perceptions of products and services.
The GUEST Model: Implement the GUEST model (Gain attention, Understand the needs, Explain about the product/service, Suggest, Thank you) to engage customers effectively and provide personalized solutions.
Gain Attention: Learn effective techniques to capture customers' attention and make positive first impressions.
Understand the Needs: Develop active listening skills to comprehend customers' requirements and preferences accurately.
Explain about the Product/Service: Master the art of product/service presentation and confidently communicate the unique value propositions.
Suggest: Explore consultative selling approaches to recommend tailored solutions that meet customers' specific needs.
Thank You: Understand the importance of expressing gratitude and maintaining customer relationships through genuine appreciation.
Join us on this transformative journey towards Sales and Service Excellence, and empower yourself to elevate customer experience and drive long-term business growth.

courses.description:
A digital business is a business that uses technology to sell to its customers and complete day-to-day operations. Digital businesses use technology to not only automate their daily business processes but also create new value in their business models, customer experience ad internal capabilities. This can also include offering telemedicine services, providing customers a virtual shopping experience at retail outlets, and setting up a remote workforce,  Uber is an example of digital business. Successful digital businesses invest i tech solutions that are scalable, flexible, and help adapt to the changing IT landscape. This helps create a strong digital core, which includes IT infrastructure that position your business for the long-term growth. it is very important to build the right technology and  tools for a successful online business. Getting the right talent to help you achieved your digital business goal is very important for the business.
If you are unsure of what you want to achieve from digital transformation strategy, your business may end up being half-baked or going in the wrong direction. Set target goals that are specific, measurable, achievable, realistic and timely. The digital space is changing always, to keep abreast with current development, you need to evaluate your digital business model regularly against industry and market changes.
target_audience: CEO, directors, managers, employees, students, businessmen, online workers, consultants, technology professional, business mogul, government agencies, Investors, etc

courses.title: Storytelling in Fundraising
courses.bio: Define your why, connect your story to your cause, turn facts into narratives, and engage donors with words and visuals.
objectives: Craft your own story and connect it with your purpose
How to work with numbers and data in fundraising
How to break down numbers and connect them to a story
Pictures in fundraising - do's and don'ts

Introduction and crafting your story: Connecting your story to your cause
Connecting data and numbers with your st: An example from Bridging Gaps: Amito's story
Pictures, bonus & wrap-up: Bonus: Creative ways of fundraising - example of the BG Fundraising Fellowship
Thank you and see you soon!

requirements: Introductory and interactive course - no need to prepare anything or have prior knowledge
courses.description:
Storytelling is one of the most powerful tools in fundraising. Facts and figures matter - but what really inspires people to give is a story that connects them to your mission, your cause, and your passion. This course will show you how to craft those stories with clarity and confidence.
Whether you are completely new to fundraising or already working in the field, you will learn step by step how to create narratives that move hearts and mobilize resources. We will start with the foundation: your why. You’ll discover how to craft your own story as a changemaker and connect it to the cause you are fundraising for. From there, we’ll dive into how to transform numbers and facts into meaningful, memorable messages - and how to combine them with storytelling techniques to inspire action.
Drawing on real examples from Bridging Gaps, an award-winning refugee-led nonprofit, we’ll explore practical storytelling strategies that you can apply right away. You’ll also learn how to use photos effectively to strengthen your message and build trust with donors. As a bonus, I will introduce you to the Bridging Gaps Fundraising Fellowship concept – a practical model for empowering communities through fundraising.
By the end of this course, you will have the tools to:
Tell your personal story with confidence
Link your story to your organization’s mission
Turn data and facts into compelling narratives
Use visuals to engage and inspire donors
If you are ready to unlock the power of storytelling in fundraising and raise more funds for your cause, this course is for you.
target_audience: Fundraising beginners or fundraising experts who want to reconnect with their purpose and learn a storytelling-based approach. Nonprofit staff or founders. Students of international relations, nonprofit management, and similar programs.

courses.description:
In the world of life sciences, pharmaceuticals, and healthcare, maintaining the integrity of temperature-sensitive products is crucial. With the rise of digital innovations, Cold Chain 4.0 is transforming the way we manage, monitor, and ensure compliance in cold chain logistics. This course provides you with a comprehensive understanding of Cold Chain 4.0, exploring cutting-edge technologies such as the Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Blockchain, and more.
Through a detailed exploration of these technologies and their applications in ensuring compliance, efficiency, and traceability, this course equips you with the practical knowledge needed to optimize your cold chain operations. You will learn how to integrate modern digital tools into your current operations, how to manage risks effectively, and how to comply with global regulatory standards.
This course is designed for professionals in the life sciences, pharmaceutical, biotech, and healthcare sectors, including supply chain managers, quality assurance experts, and regulatory compliance officers. Whether you're looking to improve your understanding of cold chain logistics or explore the latest trends in digital transformation, this course will provide you with actionable insights, best practices, and real-world applications to implement immediately.


What You Will Learn:
Understanding Cold Chain 4.0: Gain a comprehensive overview of Cold Chain 4.0, including its importance in the life sciences and pharmaceutical industries, and how it ensures the safety and integrity of temperature-sensitive products.
Digital Innovations in Cold Chain: Learn how the Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Blockchain are revolutionizing cold chain logistics, enhancing transparency, traceability, and efficiency.
Cold Chain Compliance & Best Practices: Master the regulatory requirements and best practices for maintaining compliance with GDP, GMP, and other global standards in cold chain logistics.
Risk Management: Explore advanced risk management strategies and learn how to anticipate and mitigate risks to ensure cold chain integrity at every step.
Validation & Qualification: Understand the importance of validating and qualifying cold chain systems to meet regulatory compliance and operational efficiency.
Auditing & Lifecycle Management: Learn how to audit cold chain logistics processes, ensuring consistent quality control and adherence to industry standards over the lifecycle of temperature-sensitive products.


Course Features:
09 Expert-Led Modules: Covering all aspects of Cold Chain 4.0, from digital technologies to compliance, risk management, auditing, and more.
Real-World Case Studies: Understand how companies are successfully implementing Cold Chain 4.0 technologies in their operations.
Actionable Insights: Learn practical strategies that you can implement immediately to optimize your cold chain processes.
Interactive Quizzes : Test your knowledge with quizzes after each module.


Enroll Today to Master the Future of Cold Chain Logistics:
With this course, you'll be equipped to make informed decisions, optimize cold chain processes, and ensure that temperature-sensitive products remain safe and compliant in a rapidly changing world.
Start today and become a leader in the next generation of cold chain logistics and life sciences compliance!

courses.title: CIPS L4M7 Whole-Life Asset Management (*NEW* 2023 Syllabus)
courses.bio: Diploma in Procurement and Supply
courses.description:
The practice test was written by the Procurement Study Buddy and contains carefully crafted questions and answers based on the content of the study guide - these are not actual passed questions from real CIPS exams as these are no longer issued by CIPS and would be an infringement of copyright. It serves as a revision only and not intended to be an exact replica of the live exams but it will at least highlight which learning outcomes you are strong on and which ones you may need to revised more on. Who this course is for:

Learners who are taking the L4M7 Whole-Life Asset Management (2023 Syllabus).
Learners who wish to pass the CIPS Level 4 exams - Diploma in Procurement and Supply.
Learners who want to gain confidence in passing the exams by practicing the syllabus.
Anyone who wants to know more about procurement in general.
Whole-life asset management takes into account the total cost of a product or service, from idea through to disposal including purchase, hire or lease, maintenance, operation, utilities, training and disposal. It is important for those involved in procurement and supply to take these elements into consideration when assessing options of buying, renting or leasing equipment. Although costly, there are a range of factors organisations assess to determine the approach to inventory, and the management and control of inventory is an important driver for organisational success. This module is designed for those with responsibility for the whole-life management of assets and enables learners to analyse methods for inventory movement and control and to consider the concept of whole-life asset cost.

On completion of this module, learners will be able to explain methods of inventory management, inventory analysis and the concept of whole-life asset management cost, from idea through to disposal.

Thank you for taking this course with me.

Procurement Study Buddy
target_audience: Anyone planning a career in procurement and supply
First year of an undergraduate degree course
Suitable for those in operational roles or those managing or supervising the procurement and supply function
Suitable for those who want to develop their career and work towards MCIPS Chartered Procurement and Supply Professional.

In the earlier phases of my academic journey, I prided myself on adapting well to traditional learning methods. The grades reflected my dedication, and all seemed in order. But a shift in the winds came when I transitioned to university. Excitedly, I changed my program, expecting a smooth transition. But reality was harsher; I found myself in uncharted waters, and to my shock, I failed almost all my subjects in a semester.
The setback was a blow to my confidence. But instead of sinking into despair, I took it as a challenge. I dived deep into the realm of effective learning strategies, seeking methods to improve retention, comprehension, and application. With sheer determination and these new techniques, my results began to soar once again. Yet, there was a cost: time. What I gained in academic excellence, I lost in countless hours spent mastering these strategies.
Enter ChatGPT. Its integration into my studies was like a breath of fresh air in a stuffy room. In this course, I'll not only share the highs and lows of my journey but also the invaluable methods and how to power-charge them with ChatGPT. Let me guide you on this transformative path, where challenges turn into stepping stones, and learning becomes not just efficient but enjoyable.

The Master in Integral Coaching is a complete program designed to enhance your personal and professional transformation. Throughout this master's program, you will acquire a deep knowledge and mastery of the tools and techniques of coaching, addressing key areas such as business creation, business coaching, life coaching and nutrition coaching.


During the program, you will learn to develop leadership, effective communication, time management, decision making and problem solving skills. You will learn to identify and leverage your strengths, overcome your limitations and achieve your goals effectively.


This master's degree will provide you with an integral vision of coaching, giving you the necessary tools to guide others in their process of change and personal growth. You will learn to establish trusting and empathetic relationships with your clients, helping them to discover and tap into their full potential.


During the exciting Business and Executive Coaching course, you will explore the fundamental tools and strategies for developing leadership skills, making effective decisions and driving business growth. This program will provide you with the competencies necessary to guide individuals and teams toward achieving their goals and unleashing their full potential. Get ready to acquire a deep insight into business management and organizational dynamics, all enriched by the powerful practice of executive coaching.


Details of each course that makes up the Master's program:
In our exciting Business Creation course, you'll dive into the exciting world of entrepreneurship. You will learn how to turn your ideas into solid and successful business opportunities. You'll explore the key aspects of strategic planning, market research, securing financing and effective resource management. In addition, we will equip you with the skills necessary to develop solid business plans and effective marketing strategies. This course is a complete guide for those who dream of launching their own venture and wish to do so successfully and confidently.
Explore the impact of the Sales Coaching course and unleash your potential in the business world with our comprehensive course. You will learn to master persuasion, build strong customer relationships, overcome objections and close sales effectively, regardless of your level of previous sales experience. Through intensive training, you will acquire essential skills such as emotional intelligence, verbal and non-verbal communication, adapting to customer needs, and persuasive closing techniques. Our course will empower you to transform your sales skills into tangible results, building lasting relationships and achieving sales success.
In our inspirational Life and Personal Coaching course, you will embark on a journey of self-discovery and empowerment. You will learn how to manage your life in a balanced and effective way, acquiring the necessary tools to achieve your personal and professional goals. This course will guide you in identifying and overcoming your fears and obstacles that often limit your growth. You will discover how to cultivate self-confidence and develop the mindset necessary to face challenges with determination. In short, we will equip you with the skills and knowledge to live a full life without limitations, reaching your full potential in all areas of your life.
In the Nutritional Coaching course, you will immerse yourself in the exciting world of nutrition and wellness. You will learn an in-depth understanding of the principles of healthy, balanced nutrition and how they affect your health and vitality. During the course, you will gain knowledge about food groups, essential nutrients and best practices for planning personalized diets. In addition, we will teach you nutrition coaching skills that will enable you to guide others towards a healthier and more conscious lifestyle. You will learn to identify your clients' individual needs and develop strategies to achieve nutritional and wellness goals. At the end of this course, you will be prepared to help people transform their lives through healthier and more sustainable eating.
Our "Power Your Voice: The Art of Public Speaking" course provides you with the essential skills to communicate confidently and effectively in any situation. You will learn to master your voice, improve pronunciation and articulation, structure persuasive speeches and overcome stage fright. Upon completion, you will be able to face public speaking challenges with confidence, leaving a lasting impression on the audience and achieving successful communication in a variety of contexts.
In our Productivity at Work - The Best Habits and Skills for Being Productive at Work course, you will immerse yourself in a journey of self-discovery and personal and professional improvement. You will learn how to master the essential strategies and skills to increase your work efficiency, manage your time effectively and achieve your work goals with confidence. This course will provide you with the tools you need to overcome common challenges in the work environment and equip you with the leadership, communication and stress management skills necessary to excel in your career.
Discover in our course "Habits and Mental Changes Needed to Stop Procrastination" an in-depth perspective on this habit that affects so many aspects of our lives. You will learn how to identify the underlying causes of procrastination, how to overcome it and develop strategies to improve your productivity. You will explore effective techniques and learn how to establish habits that will help you accomplish your goals. In addition, you will understand the influence of neuroscience on your behavior and how to take advantage of this knowledge. Join us and take the first step to free yourself from procrastination and achieve a more productive and satisfying life.


We are waiting for you at Mywebstudies

courses.description:
Overwhelmed? You are not alone, AND there's something you can do about it. This course is designed for busy working mothers who are tired of doing it all and are ready to step up as a leader at home and at work.
What’s the difference between a burnt-out working mom and a powerhouse executive? Not what you think. It’s not about doing more—it’s about being audacious enough to do less.
When her husband suggested having a third child during an overwhelmingly stressful week of juggling toddlers and corporate life, Corinne Cavanaugh hit her breaking point. Drawing from her experience as a marketing executive and mother of three, in this course Corinne reveals how she transformed from drowning in perfectionism to thriving through radical delegation at home and audacious time management at work. Through research-backed strategies and personal insights, students will learn Corinne's Audacious Mother Leader Framework to create success at work and sanity at home.
Attendees will leave with a proven framework for turning motherhood into a leadership advantage, equipped with actionable strategies for defending their time, delegating radically, and leading confidently. With only 28% of C-suite positions held by women, this course empowers mothers to recognize their unique leadership capabilities without sacrificing their families — they just need to be audacious enough to rewrite the rules.

courses.title: Living Law® China- from ancient empire to global superpower
courses.bio: Confucius says: take this course!
objectives: the eternal debate of whether norms of morality or formal rules lead to a happier society
the impact of Confucianist thinking on Chinese and Asian culture
how China became unified under a single Emperor, with divine authority
why China built a Great Wall to shut out barbarians, and how later barbarians arrived nonetheless
how China's Imperial period came to an end, eventually leading to Civil War
the impact of Communist victory on China's 20th century evolution
how economic reform transformed China, but also triggered increasing trade disputes

Introduction: Side note- China in the interwar period
The People's Republic of China during the Mao Era
Deng Xiaopeng and China's Economic Reforms
China Rejoins the World ... and Joins the World Trade Organization (WTO)
A Rising China: Can Economic and Political Liberalization be Divorced?

requirements: None, though an interest in history and curiosity about the world helps
courses.description:
We start this course by travelling back in time to Imperial China. We explore the debate around the effectiveness of morality and ethics, reinforced by societal shame if breached. We then compare this to models relying on formal rules and laws, with breaches punished financially or physically. Confucian China preferred the former approach, though the Imperial Court dabbled in the latter at times in its history.
With a solid footing in the Imperial period, we explore the impact of European arrivals, in particular the so-called "century of shame." We then move forward to modern China, examining the civil war period and the victory of the Communists. We then trace the evolution of communism in China, investigating periods of extreme control including over thought, expression, and life itself.
Finally, we look at China's shift to a market economy and consider how that works within a Communist/socialist framework. China's joining of the World Trade Organization (WTO) was a game-changer for international trade, with huge repercussions for China and the rest of the world. Now the entire international trade legal order is being called into question- so where does that leave China ... and all other nations?
The "peaceful rise" of China is perhaps the most important geopolitical development of the 21st century.
target_audience: businesspersons, educators and students, travellers, professional and armchair diplomats

courses.description:
Welcome to the Excel Bible – a fast and practical course designed to take you from beginner to advanced in just 2.5 hours!
Whether you're new to Excel or already familiar with its basics, this course is structured to help you simplify your daily work, automate repetitive tasks, and analyze data with confidence.
You'll start with the fundamentals: logical functions like IF, AND, OR, data validation, conditional formatting, and cell referencing. Then, you’ll dive into powerful lookup functions like VLOOKUP, XLOOKUP, and INDEX & MATCH, which will help you build dynamic and flexible formulas.
From there, we’ll explore Pivot Tables, one of Excel’s most valuable tools for summarizing large data sets — followed by creating professional charts (bar, column, line, pie) to visualize your insights effectively.
You’ll also learn how to recognize and fix common Excel errors, improving your confidence and troubleshooting skills. To top it off, the course includes an introduction to macros and VBA programming to help you start automating tasks in Excel.
This course is hands-on and includes downloadable Excel files so you can follow along with each lecture.

courses.description:
Digital transformation is the integration of digital technology into all areas of business, fundamentally changing how you operate your business and also gives values to your cherished customers. It can be said that its a cultural change that requires organizations to continually challenges the status quo, experiment and be prepared to received any outcome. A digital initiative can contain many different aspects. At one extreme, it can involve reinventing all facet of the organization, including supply chain, workflows, employee skill set, the product it self, how customers interact with the organization, and organization structure. More limited initiative can involve adopting digital technology to improve a specific business process, or service, reduce costs, or solve a specific business problem.
Business model transformation is key, this type of transformation changes business models to adapt them to the new digital environment. This requires careful consideration of how the core business of the industry operates. A successful change can disrupt an entire industry- like Netflix did for home videos and Amazon for retail. Digital transformation has a cultural component, which is critical to the success of any digital transformation initiative. For example many organizations, this transition can be challenging. Digital transformation must start with education for existing staff, to ensure everyone understands the potential of new technology for improving the business, forging internal collaboration, and creating new methods for engaging customers. There are multiple common barriers that digital transformation initiatives, projects and strategies face. One of the main barriers is change management because changes in processes may face active resistance from workers. Related to change management is the miscommunication between workers which can lead to integration due to a too optimistic view of the process. Companies may have legal systems in place which can lead to integration difficulties with new systems.
target_audience: Managers, consultants, employees, CEO, directors, self employed, businessmen, business mogul, HR managers, leaders, government agencies, manufacturing companies, students, everybody etc

courses.description:
Most of us are familiar with Word's basic tools for creating simple letters or even basic reports. However, when it comes to writing essays, assignments, dissertations and academic papers; there are a lot of very useful tools that should be used, but often don't get used. This could be because the student doesn't know how to use the tools, or sometimes it's because the student doesn't know they exist.
This course provides the student with an extensive range of Word tools and formatting options that will not only save a huge amount of time, but will also give documents a professional 'polished' look, ready for submission.  On completion of the course, students will be able to create documents that include Table of Contents, Indexes, Citations and Bibliographies, and much more.
The course is divided into 6 sections and a total of 27 lectures. Each lecture will 'walk' the student through the content by way of a demonstration video (including captions and transcript) and also a downloadable document.  In total there is just over 1½ hours of video learning. The average run-time for each video is 3½ minutes, so students should find they can comfortably cover the lectures in short bursts.  Before starting a lecture, students should download the Resources  'Information' document that accompanies the video and also provides useful reminder tips and shortcuts. Students can also download the Word document demonstrated in the video, so that they can have a go by following the video instructions.
At the end of each section there is a short multiple-choice quiz. If the student gives the incorrect answer for any question, they will be directed to the video that contains the answer.
Students are encouraged to provide any comments, questions or suggestions relating to the course.  Where appropriate the course instructor will provide additional content.
target_audience: This course is for any student who needs to write essays, assignments, or dissertations.
The content has been adapted and developed after the author has run many 'live' courses for students of different academic levels.

courses.description:
Today, AI isn't just a futuristic idea. It's already integrated into many of the tools you use every day, whether you realize it or not. It helps filter spam in your email, powers customer support chatbots, and even suggests who to connect with on professional networks. Our company is embracing AI to remain competitive and innovative, but with that comes a shared responsibility.
This isn't just an internal guideline; it's a global mandate. Regulations like the EU AI Act - Article 4, the U.S. Executive Orders, and India’s DPDP Act are shaping how businesses must use this technology. To stay compliant and protect our company's integrity, every one of us must understand what's safe, what's risky, and what's prohibited when using AI.
Every employee is a user of AI, and misusing it—even by accident—can have serious consequences.
Accidentally pasting sensitive client data into a public AI tool could lead to a major data breach.
Using AI without proper oversight can introduce bias into our work, harming our reputation and fairness.
Failing to comply with regulations could expose our company to significant legal and financial risks.
On the other hand, employees who understand how to use AI responsibly and smartly will gain a huge advantage. You can save hours on routine tasks, improve accuracy in your work, and unlock new ideas and innovations.This course is designed to equip you with the knowledge to be both productive and compliant, turning a potential risk into a powerful opportunity.
This course is structured to build your knowledge from the ground up.
Modules 1–5 will build your foundational knowledge. We’ll explore what AI is, identify common risks, and review key global laws and our internal policies.
Modules 6–7 will focus on practical application. This is where we get hands-on with effective and responsible ways to collaborate with AI tools.
Module 8 is our capstone. You'll get to apply everything you've learned through real-world scenarios and a final quiz to test your mastery.
Can’t wait to see you inside the course!
target_audience: This course is applicable to anyone—whether you’re an individual learner or an employee in an organization.

I’m Stephen Burt, executive coach and author with over 20 years of experience teaching leadership and communication skills to executives, MBA students, and global organisations. I created this course to offer you a fresh, practical way to sharpen your listening using small, proven practices drawn from real-world experience.
This is not a theoretical course. You’ll actively explore listening through four powerful “rooms” of practice:
Attention: Strengthen focus and stay present—even under pressure.
Curiosity: Ask questions that deepen conversations and build trust.
Observation: Notice what’s not being said—body language, tone, energy.
Intuition: Tune in to subtle signals and your own inner responses.
The exercises are simple but effective—from noticing silence in a café to observing energy at a rock concert. Each practice builds your capacity to listen with purpose and clarity.
By the end of this course, you’ll:
Understand your current listening habits
Improve your attention span in real-time conversations
Build stronger relationships through deep, curious listening
Apply techniques to both personal and professional settings
Create a listening culture within your team or organisation
Whether you're a leader, coach, team member, or simply someone who wants to connect more deeply with others, this course will help you level up your listening in a way that delivers real impact.
Ready to listen better and lead smarter? Step into the Listening Dojo.
target_audience: Professionals, leaders, coaches, or anyone looking to improve how they listen and connect.

Introduction: Masterclass To Your Blockbuster Game Empire
What You Will Learn: Learning Blueprint: Mapping Your Course Journey
